intro: Silene kuschakewiczii, commonly known as the Kuschakewicz’s campion, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, adapting to harsh alpine environments. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Silene kuschakewiczii is considered a species of conservation concern.
